text: Les James Murray AM (László Ürge; 5 November 1945NAA: A2478/19 URGE J/BOX 158, Non-British European migrant selection documents, National Archives of Australia – 31 July 2017) was a Hungarian-Australian sports journalist, soccer broadcaster and analyst. He was born in Budapest. He was the host of The World Game on SBS television. He retired in July 2014.http://theworldgame.sbs.com.au/article/2014/06/07/les-murray-end-era He has been inducted into the FFA's Football Hall of Fame. Murray died on 31 July 2017 in Sydney, Australia after a long-illness at the age of 71. ==References== ==Other websites== *Les Murray at Random House Australia *Interview with Les Murray, SBS Soccer Announcer *Les Murray's retraction of published allegations against Lucas Neill Category:1945 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Disease-related deaths in Sydney Category:Sportspeople from Budapest Category:Australian journalists Category:Australian television presenters Category:Writers from Budapest
title: Les Murray (broadcaster)
